text: Johnny Belinda is a 1948 American drama movie directed by Jean Negulesco and based on the 1940 play of the same name by Elmer Blaney Harris. It stars Jane Wyman, Lew Ayres, Charles Bickford, Agnes Moorehead, Stephen McNally and was distributed by Warner Bros.. It was nominated for 12 Oscars and won an Academy Award in 1949. ==Awards== Award Category Recipient Result Academy Awards Best Picture Jerry Wald (for Warner Bros.) Best Director Jean Negulesco Best Actor Lew Ayres Best Actress Jane Wyman Best Supporting Actor Charles Bickford Best Supporting Actress Agnes Moorehead Best Screenplay Irma von Cube and Allen Vincent Best Art Direction-Set Decoration – Black-and-White Robert M. Haas and William O. Wallace Best Cinematography – Black-and-White Ted D. McCord Best Film Editing David Weisbart Best Score of a Dramatic or Comedy Picture Max Steiner Best Sound Recording Nathan Levinson Golden Globe Awards Best Picture Best Actress in a Leading Role Jane Wyman National Board of Review Awards Top Ten Films Photoplay Awards Most Popular Female Star Jane Wyman Picturegoer Awards Best Actress Venice International Film Festival Golden Lion Jean Negulesco Writers Guild of America Awards Best Written American Drama Irma von Cube and Allen Vincent The movie is recognized by American Film Institute in these lists: * 2005: AFI's 100 Years of Film Scores – Nominated ==Notes== ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Category:1948 drama movies Category:American drama movies Category:Movies based on plays Category:Movies directed by Jean Negulesco Category:Golden Globe Award winning movies Category:Warner Bros. movies Category:Movies set in Nova Scotia
title: Johnny Belinda
